alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 18 at 7:19PM EDT until May 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, one to two feet of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.8 to 8.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Significant saltwater inundation will render numerous roads impassable. Properties may also flood. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 8:08 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/08 PM 7.9 2.0 1.3 N/A Moderate 19/08 AM 6.0 0.2 1.0 N/A None 19/09 PM 7.1 1.3 0.7 N/A Minor 20/09 AM 5.5 -0.3 0.6 N/A None 20/10 PM 6.8 1.0 0.6 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
